Class KeyShare

java.lang.Object
model.KeyShare
public class KeyShare extends Object
Represents a share of a secret key in a threshold cryptography scheme.

This class implements Shamir's Secret Sharing , allowing a key to be split into multiple parts, with a threshold number required for reconstruction.

Each share contains:

  • An x-coordinate (the share identifier)
  • A y-coordinate (the share value)
  • The prime modulus used in the finite field
  • A verification hash to ensure the share hasn't been tampered with

This is used by the Tallying Authority to split its private key among multiple trustees, requiring collaboration for vote decryption.

  • Constructor Details

    • KeyShare

      public KeyShare(int x, BigInteger y, BigInteger prime)
      Constructs a key share with the specified coordinates and prime modulus.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the share (share identifier)
      y - The y-coordinate of the share (share value)
      prime - The prime modulus for the finite field

    • KeyShare

      public KeyShare(int x, BigInteger y)
      Constructs a key share with the specified coordinates and a default large prime.

      Uses a 2048-bit prime by default.

      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the share (share identifier)
      y - The y-coordinate of the share (share value)

      public BigInteger getY()
      Gets the y-coordinate (value) of the share.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate

    • verify

      public boolean verify()
      Verifies that the share has not been tampered with.

      This method recomputes the hash of the share's components and compares it to the stored verification hash.

      Returns:
      true if the share is valid, false if it has been modified
